entry.title: Fix crash in PrefetchContainer::TakeBlockUntilHeadTimer.
entry.content:
The crash was caused when a user tried to start another navigation while

Chrome was waiting for the head of a prefetch to return. This caused the

CHECK in PrefetchContainer::TakeBlockUntilHeadTimer and DCHECK in

PrefetchContainer::SetOnReceivedHeadCallback to fail. This CL removes

those checks (since its safe to overwrite block_until_head_timer_ and

on_receive_head_callback_), and adds a test to confirm this.



Bug: 1467354

entry.title: Revert "Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3f230b34cb1c992a6fbb11132c17228619f06692.



Reason for revert: Possible culprit for UAF errors in tests in

builder: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests



Original change's description:

> Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon.

>

> In its GetInstance(), it keeps the raw ptr in its static local

> variable, while it returns scoped_refptr.

> When all scoped_refptrs referring the instance are destroyed,

> the instance is also destroyed, so the static local pointer will

> gets dangling pointer.

> Fortunately, we didn't hit the case in production/tests,

> but following fix of tests will hit the issue.

>

> This CL initializes/shutdowns explicitly to avoid the case.

>

> BUG=1325210

> TEST=Tryjob

>

> Change-Id: I698968a9732aec09bdf294cb3ef08e2fde933488

entry.title: Deprecate non-shared mem child process field trial sync codepath.
entry.content:
Per UMA histograms, this only gets hit by a handful of clients on

a given day and doesn't make sense to support anymore.



Also simplifies some ifdefs by removing some unnecessary

!BUILDFLAG(IS_NACL) ones that were previously needed to avoid compile

errors with NACL, but aren't needed now. (No behavior change, as IS_NACL

doesn't call these codepaths, just cleaning up ifdef complexity.)



Additionally:

- Renames CreateFeaturesFromCommandLine() to

ApplyFeatureOverridesInChildProcess() to match its functionality.

- Renames CreateTrialsFromCommandLine() to

CreateTrialsInChildProcess() and changes two call sites to instead

call CreateTrialsFromString() since those call sites do not use

shared memory.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Removed July 2023 with the removal of the fallback codepath.

entry.title: Add append_to argument to Clone() to avoid extra InsertedInto calls
entry.content:
Because of the order of operations for Clone(), previous to this CL,

the typical sequence would be:



1. Clone the element

2. Clone the children of the element (recursing to step #1).

3. AppendChild() each cloned child to its parent cloned element.

4. (in the caller of Clone) AppendChild the cloned element to its

eventual parent.



Because each AppendChild triggers a call to Node::InsertedInto() for

*all descendants of the appended element* [1], the fact that the tree

is constructed bottom-up (leaf nodes first) means that InsertedInto()

is called N^2 times, where N is the depth of the cloned tree.



Because clone-and-append is a very common pattern, this CL adds an

`append_to` argument to `Clone()`, which appends to the parent before

appending the children.



This CL also adds a perf test for this scenario (cloning a deep tree).

Locally, on a debug build, this test gives 0.13 runs/s before this CL,

and 0.40 runs/s after, for a 3.1X speedup.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/dom/container_node.cc;l=1006;drc=5d60017dba57e86d477634812e1340127734f8a7



Bug: 1453291

Change-Id: Icdd75c45aa5ecc4fe8bb5d1ff0b7a2b27bec2171

entry.title: [Tailored Security] Add RETRY_NEEDED and NO_RETRY_NEEDED states
entry.content:
We'll use these states instead of the others to track whether to retry

the tailored security flow.



In order to represent these states better, we had to rename the enum and

add a new preference key to hold the value moving forward. The new key

is: safebrowsing.aesb_sync_flow_retry_state. The old key was:

safebrowsing.aesb_sync_flow_last_user_interaction_state. Since we no

longer need the old key, we filed crbug.com/1469133 to track deprecation

of the key. The value being registered is now of type

`TailoredSecurityRetryState`. This should be an OK substitution because

the UNSET value remains unchanged and this is the only value that has

been written to preferences.

entry.title: [infra] Add a flag to control handling of dimension_sets.
entry.content:
This change adds a --dimension-sets flag to generate_buildbot_json.py

that controls how the dimension_sets field will be handled as part of

the process to remove support for dimension_sets. The flag must have one

of the following values:

* restrict (default) - Fail if any dimension_sets field has more than 1

dimension set. Also fail if any generated test has more than 1

dimension set. There are no explicit multiple element dimension sets

and the only builder that had generated tests with multiple element

dimension sets has been switched to a multi-tester model instead, so

this should simply prevent someone from adding instances of multiple

dimension sets.

* convert - Fail if any dimension_sets field has more than 1 dimension

set, convert single element dimension sets to a dimensions field.

* disable - Fail if any dimension_sets fields are present.



The convert setting will be used to update the angle configs while the

dimension_sets fields are still present in the chromium configs. The

disable setting will be used to update the chrome and clank configs.

Once the setting is adjusted in the other locations, support for

dimension sets can be removed from the generator.

entry.title: [Tab Strip] Avoid closing tabs inside commitAllTabClosures.
entry.content:
Credit to agdoug@amazon.com for the testcase and helping to track

down where this is originating after I added some asserts last week.

Also for suggesting the StripLayoutHelperTest fix.



What looks to be happening is that during commitAllTabClosures the

TabletTabStrip as part of its animation cycles pushes more updates

to close tabs that weren't part of the last animation batch. This

results in a concurrent modification to PendingTabClosureManager's

mTabClosureEvents.



I think post tasking the closures will avoid this issue, but I'm

not an expert on Tablet Tab Strip so reviewers please let me

know your thoughts.



An alternative approach might be to just commit all tab

closures in the queue, but this risks leaving the mRewoundList

and mTabClosureEvents objects in a bad state so I'd rather we fix

this at the source.

entry.content:

arguments inside the pin_keyboard. This leads to a caret becoming zero

each time when digital button is pressed on screen. It sets caret to a

correct position first and then some parent component updates focus

which causes the bug. It doesn't happen if user uses physical keyboard.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Prepare to align more bindings with spec
entry.content:
Work on setBid() showed that things around timeouts are tricky:

a SafeForTerminationScope needs to be created, and it's really easy to

accidentally cancel the timeout when propagating the exception.



To make it easier for other bindings, this makes TimeLimitScope

create v8's SafeForTerminationScope itself, rather than require

every binding to get it right.



Similarly, a helper is added to properly forward conversion

errors to v8, which makes sure not to overwrite the timeout, deals

with text errors vs. things that were originally exceptions, etc.



SetBid got ported to these methods, and since it has to also forward the

error to the worklet when it's used as a helper for return value, the

non-IDL levels got changed to be packed into IdlConvert::Result, too,

for consistency.

entry.title: Make room for page margins in web tests.
entry.content:
With CL:4725066, page size calculation is done inside Blink, rather than

in PrintRenderFrameHelper & co. This makes it much easier to support web

tests properly, since we don't use PrintRenderFrameHelper in such cases

(and would otherwise have to duplicate its logic). For now, add support

for page margins. Later on, mixed page sizes will just work

out-of-the-box, once support for that has been added to the layout code

(upcoming CL).

entry.title: Reland: Fix coordinate transforms and clean up.
entry.content:
MenuController event handlers expect the coordinates of provided events

to be in the scroll view container coordinate system (a.k.a. the submenu

root view). Some tests complied with this, others did not. Fix all of

them to be the same.



One test was also failing on Win 11 (and, soon, on other platforms)

because using bubble menus with corner radii resulted in exceeding the

hardcoded size reserved for the menu. Configure this dynamically

instead.



This finally cleans up various other things, e.g. lack of

make_unique<>(), type repetition, etc.

This reverts commit 9cb8b68d80c216491feb846b9084390f9c0de824.



Reason for revert: Cause of crbug.com/1469105: [immersive mode mac] Toolbar disappears / black area appears



Original change's description:

> [Mac Immersive Fullscreen] Prevent spaces switch on child window removal

>

> Removing a child window from a fullscreen window that isn't on the

> active space causes a switch to that space. This cl adds machinery to

> defer child window removals until a window becomes active, exits fullscreen, closes.

>

> Bug: 1454606

>

entry.title: [A11y] Use title value when the input type image with empty alt and
entry.content:
non-empty title



At the discussion[1], in case of the `img` element, it is written to use

the alt even if it is an empty string explicitly. But in case of alt of

input type=image, there is no explicit description of empty value. So

like aria-label and aria-labelledby, it was understood that if it has

an empty value, it allows a meaningful value in the next step to be used.



Therefore, the `title` value has been changed to be used as accessible

name, according to the accessible name computation algorithm[2], when

the `alt` attribute does not provide a meaningful value.



[1]: https://github.com/w3c/html-aam/issues/414

[2]: https://www.w3.org/TR/html-aam-1.0/#img-element-accessible-name-computation



Signed-off-by: Hunseop Jeong

Bug: 1342873

Change-Id: Ifc7dfcd22897f0a59943c2330b5808afb494f889

entry.title: Printing: Move page size calculation to Blink.
entry.content:
This is in preparation for mixed page sizes support (which will be added

in an upcoming CL).



We need to set the correct size for each individual page during layout.

Remove the concept of "*the* page size", since each page can have its

own size. Note, however, that we still need a uniform page size to use

as the initial containing block, which is used to resolve viewport

units, among other things. The spec defines the initial containing block

as the page area size of the first page:

https://www.w3.org/TR/css-page-3/#page-model



As a result of this change, some cleanup in PrintRenderFrameHelper

should be possible (in future CLs). For one, we no longer need to lay

out everything twice, since we lay out with the correct page sizes in

the first layout pass (rather than first using printer defaults, then

read out sizes and pargins specified in @page rules, and then lay out

again with the correct sizes). It should also be possible to untangle

some margin logic in PrintRenderFrameHelper, since Blink now only

applies CSS-specified margins when it should (e.g. not if the user has

chosen their own margins in the print preview UI). Furthermore, there

are redundant fields in WebPrintParams. We no longer need to store a

page size or content area size (since we're providing a

WebPrintPageDescription now).



PrintContext no longer stores a vector of page rectangles. They will

instead be calculated when needed. We only used the rectangles when

printing with Blink, whereas ChromePluginPrintContext was forced to

populate a page_rects_ vector, just so that we could return the correct

number of pages. Since the code for calculating the page rectangles has

been rewritten, especially when it comes to how additional pages caused

by monolithic content is calculated, I added a web test for that, since

it turned out that we didn't have a good test for that particular case.



No behavior changes intended.



Bug: 835358

Change-Id: Ic669071b3e0ac729a467321720e25d6101e7b13f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4725066

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

entry.title: [iOS] NTP Visibility State
entry.content:
Creates a NewTabPageState for each web state that is responsible for

saving the scroll position and selected feed. This state can be

expanded to include other saved properties in the future.



Prevents the need for the NewTabPageMediator to observe the web state,

and also removes the `webState` property from it. Moves NTP state

management to fully reside in the NTP coordinator. This is to

remove an anti-pattern where the NTP mediator would get the scroll

position from the VC, which was against the expected flow of

information. Also allows us to remove the CS mediator dependency from

the NTP mediator.



Moves state unit test from mediator to coordinator so that it covers

more of the implementation. Improves NTP coordinator test by removing

mocked CS coordinator which was no longer needed.



Fixed: 1403298

Change-Id: I994a13c228659b01bd82d2399a4556901f66886f

entry.title: Cleanup print job and worker after content analysis denial
entry.content:
When content analysis is done just prior to the start of printing a

document, the PrintJob intended for printing is used for the analysis.

If analysis denies printing then there is extra cleanup that is

required for the PrintJob and its worker, in particular for

out-of-process print drivers. This extra cleanup isn't isn't necessary

when analysis is done using a temporary PrintJob that is discarded when

the analysis happens before getting print settings, like what happens

with analysis before showing Print Preview.



The needed cleanup cannot be safely done within regular cancel

processing, which can occur on any thread and can happen before all

OOPPD processing is completed for the regular printing cancel case.



Add an extra call to do explicit cleanup for the content analysis

denial case just before printing a document. This guarantees that such

cleanup happens on the UI thread and that there are no pending

callbacks to worry about.



Fixed: 1457901

Change-Id: Id8b14f9e30bbfc04efa1af1271178189d6165652

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4735166

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Dominique Fauteux-Chapleau

Commit-Queue: Alan Screen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177836}

entry.content:

to recreate the scroll view container's border settings to calculate the

led to a variety of inaccuracies.

`OnDialogPresented()` and `callback` was switched due to the

semantic of `base::OnceCallback<...>::Then(...)`.



Add an helper method that invokes a callback and a closure in

the original invocation order.

entry.title: Add table to DIPS database for Popup Heuristic.
entry.content:
Context: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GJBMYuhl77eTSjLMMEtq1Y2Kd3Vdv1ozfdFi1iCueZI/edit. We want long-term storage of 1P/3P site pairs that satisfy the popup heuristic, so we can check a later storage access (up to 60 days) if it would be exempt.



This CL includes all necessary logic changes to initialize, read, write, and clean up the new `popups` table. Note that table names cannot be bound in a SQL statement, and GetCachedStatement can only be run on unique queries - so some of the duplicate code to create both bounce table and popup table queries could not be eliminated.



Bug: 1445107

entry.title: Add AuctionNonce, a unique identifier of a single call to runAdAuction.
entry.content:
This adds a new navigator.createAuctionNonce function, which returns and

keeps track of valid unique identifiers to future calls to runAdAuction.

This also adds an auctionNonce field to the AuctionAdConfig, which

callers to runAdAuction can use to specify the identifier of this

specific call to runAdAuction. All "additional bids", which are being

added in support of negative targeting, will need to provide a nonce

matching the auction for which they're fetched, in order to guarantee

that each additional bid is only used for that single auction intended

by the buyer.

entry.title: Rename chrome://safe-browsing tab from RT Lookup to URT Lookup
entry.content:
Since the chrome://safe-browsing tab now contains a tab for HPRT, we

rename the RT Lookup tab to URT Lookup for clarity.



This change is made in code names as well for the same reason, with the

following patterns:

- If it's unnecessary to specify what kind of lookup request it is,

stop doing so. (e.g. within UrlRealTimeMechanism, we can just say

OnLookupResponse instead of specifying OnRTLookupResponse)

- RTLookupRequest and RTLookupResponse are kept as-is when referring to

the proto messages directly.

- URT lookup request / URT lookup response refer on a high level to

the lookup request and response, which include the RTLookupRequest

and RTLookupResponse proto messages, but can also include other parts

of the lookup such as the oauth token that sometimes is sent.



Note: This code naming pattern is similar to what is done for the HPRT

lookups. Where relevant, the SearchHashesRequest + SearchHashesResponse

proto naming is used, but the wrapper naming is HPRT lookup request and

response.



Bug: 1466667

entry.title: [sync] Make clearing of account bookmarks upon signout more reliable
entry.content:
The logic was introduced in https://crrev.com/4527935, which tackled the

most important codepath (BookmarkModelTypeProcessor::OnSyncStopping()).



There are however two other relevant scenarios that need handling, for

better reliability, as represented by callers to

StopTrackingMetadataAndResetTracker():

1) The cache GUID mismatch upon startup, an edge case attributed to

previous writes having failed.



2) ClearMetadataWhileStopped(), which is the may fallback mechanism that

SyncServiceImpl uses to safeguard against left-behind sync metadata.

This scenario has two subvariants:

2.a) If, at the time, the model is already loaded, the clearing

happens immediately (invokes

StopTrackingMetadataAndResetTracker()).

2.b) Otherwise, the logic is deferred using member field

pending_clear_metadata_, until ModelReadyToSync() is invoked.

This also means, similar logic is required inside

ModelReadyToSync(), which is the only codepath that doesn't

involve StopTrackingMetadataAndResetTracker().



Besides, there is a minor behavioral difference for the case where

BookmarkModelTypeProcessor::OnSyncStopping() is invoked while

bookmark_tracker_ is null: now RemoveAllUserBookmarks() is never

invoked, but there is no real need to delete bookmarks if initial

sync hasn't completed (and hence remote data hasn't been incorporated

to the BookmarkModel instance).



Bug: 1444662, 1468502

Change-Id: Ic853fe250ffce2ba8eb711022ec6df3652d43659

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4728126

entry.title: [dPWA/Link Capturing] Incorporate URL ports in AppManagementPageHandler
entry.content:
This CL ensures that the supported links logic in the app management

page handler takes into account URL ports for desktop platforms.



For preferred app setting, this is automatically handled by the

WebAppRegistrar since scopes are compared based on their prefixes

using base::StartsWith, so scopes with different ports are

filtered out automatically while scopes with same ports are

treated as overlapping.



Added tests to verify this behavior on WML. Currently does not

work on CrOS.

entry.title: Fix VolumeManagerTest fixture.
entry.content:
The test set up is not following production, and so some global

code fix breaks the test unexpectedly. This CL fixes several

VolumeManagerTest's set up to be aligned with production.

- Reorder initialization and shutdown.

- Profile is ready after user session login.

- Making shutdown in the reverse order of initialization.

- Run global instance initialization, follow by User login.

- Do not use ProfileHelper::SetUserToProfileMappingForTesting

or SetAlwaysReturnPrimaryUserForTesting, which makes the

behavior diff from production bigger.

- Explicitly instantiate FakeChromeUserManager. Current code casts

FakeUserManager to FakeChromeUserManager. It looked just

unfortunately-lucky so that the test didn't hit issues, but

anyways it was UB.

- Set kUserMyFilesInUserDataDirForTesting, because several tests

verify MyFiles directory name.

- Explicitly revoke the ExternalMountPoints system instance

to isolate each test.

- Split ARC test fixture to easily control ARC part.



BUG=1325210

TEST=Tryjob



Change-Id: I5cc78d21f6cfa20cd1a0539d7ad9f1bd507d169f

entry.title: Use InlinedVector in /ui/events/gesture_detection
entry.content:
Replace usages of base::StackVector with absl::InlinedVector. This is

not a pure rename, as the semantics are slightly different:



1. Methods like push_back() which were accessed with the -> operator in

StackVector are instead accessed with . with InlinedVector.

2. The .container() method is not needed with InlinedVector



See also discussion thread in cxx@chromium.org:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/jTfqVfU-Ka0/m/caaal90NCgAJ



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Recompute aura child frame touch selection bounds on hit test updates.
entry.content:
Aura touch selection handle bounds updates usually occur when compositor

frames are sent, using new selection bounds from RenderFrameMetadata.

However, for child frames, the selection bounds can change even when the

child frame has not sent a new compositor frame, e.g. if the main frame

is resized. TouchSelectionControllerClientAura currently doesn't handle

this, which means that the touch selection handles in a child frame can

appear in the wrong spot when the main frame is resized or rotated.



This CL makes TouchSelectionControllerClientChildFrame recompute

the selection bounds on hit test region updates when it is the active

client of a corresponding TouchSelectionControllerClientAura. This is

similar to the corresponding Android code (except that Android uses

OnAggregatedHitTestRegionListUpdated, but that seems unnecessary here):

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:content/browser/renderer_host/input/touch_selection_controller_client_manager_android.cc;l=158;drc=f6319159f334b34ff6784cba52aec82da861d829



Bug: b:286954885

Change-Id: Ia7669873de31b267b4e84fce7e8892086bf4f625

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4728431

Commit-Queue: Michelle Chen

Reviewed-by: James Maclean

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177771}

entry.title: [DBSC] Sign challenge if required for cookie rotation
entry.content:
The server may require a challenge on the cookie rotation endpoint. In

this case, the server will respond to the initial rotation request with

HTTP code: 401 (Unauthorized) + a `Sec-Session-Google-Challenge` header.



This CL adds support for signing the challenge then restart a new

rotation request with the binding key assertion attached to it. If

obtaining the binding key assertion fails, the fetcher will return

`kSignChallengeFailed` error. This error is considered a persistent

error and will terminate the session.

entry.title: [FSA] Implement extended/dormant permission grant model
entry.content:
This change replaces the duration-based persistent permission model with

the new persistent permission model with extended and dormant grants.

Not included here yet is the UI to prompt users to enable the Extended

Permission mode.



It also fixes a couple of bugs: (1) only active permission list (renamed

from `origins_` for better clarity) is checked but not the persistent

permission list in various places such as `NotifyEntryMoved()`,

`RevokeGrants()`, etc and (2) `SetStatus()` does not account for the

status value for granting or revoking the object.



Please note that this change builds off of the work started on

http://crrev.com/c/4298438

entry.title: graphite: dcomp: pass update_rect from skia graphite rep to dawn rep
entry.content:
SkiaGraphiteDawnImageRepresentation::BeginWriteAccess() has

an update_rect param which is used by dcomp and dxgi swapchain

backings for post buffers. For graphite, we create

SkiaGraphiteDawnImageRepresentation from a dawn representation,

so we add the update_rect to BeginScopeAccess() to dawn

representation, so it can be passed to dcomp and dxgi swapchain

backings. For other backing, it will be ignored.

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Add safari switcher check on FRE
entry.content:
Bottom omnibox is enabled by default for safari switchers.



Device switcher result are only available after sync. To keep a coherent experience for new users, device switcher result are checked when the

user leaves NTP after FRE. This will be the first time a user see the

bottom or top unfocused omnibox. If the result are available by then and

the user is a safari switcher, bottom omnibox will be default.



A future CL will add these logs:

IOS.Omnibox.DeviceSwitcher.DataUnavailable

IOS.Omnibox.DeviceSwitcher.SafariSwitcher

IOS.Omnibox.DeviceSwitcher.Other

entry.title: Blink: Fix CanChangeToUrlForHistoryApi() to be spec-compliant
entry.content:
The `blink::CanChangeToUrlForHistoryApi()` helper takes in a target URL

and a document's current URL, and evaluates whether we can set the

latter to the former for same-document navigations. The spec equivalent

is HTML's "can have its URL rewritten" [1] algorithm.



Before this CL, that function deviated from the spec in a number of

ways:

1. It created a SecurityOrigin out of the target URL and used it for

same-origin checks with the document's actual origin. This is

fraught for `about:blank/srcdoc` KURLs which don't carry their

actual origin with them. So they're always seen as opaque, and

`history.pushState()/replaceState()` was rejected for them. Per

spec however, those APIs should work in those documents. This was

discovered in https://crrev.com/c/4690242 and is fixed here.

2. It has non-standard code that allows opaque origins to change their

fragment. This isn't actually much of an issue, and it's documented

that the behavior exists for compatibility reasons, but the issue

is that at the same time, we *disallow* path mutations for URLs

in opaque origins, even though HTML allows these modifications for

all HTTP(S) URLs, per step (2) of the spec algorithm [1].



This CL implements this step correctly and changes the

corresponding security web test expectations to expect a

path-mutating `history.pushState()` to succeed on an HTTP(S) site

running in an opaque origin.

3. It deferred to `EqualIgnoringPathQueryAndFragment()` for all other

URLs, while the HTML Standard explicitly disallows path mutations

per step (4) in the spec algorithm [1].

a. This had the positive side-effect of allowing path mutations

for "standard" URLs — like `chrome://`, `chrome-extension://`,

and `chrome-error://` — that are registered specially with

`url::AddStandardScheme()`. Chrome WebUI and extensions seem

to rely on this behavior, and that's fine since it's a

non-standard allowance.

b. The negative side-effect of (a) above is that we allowed path

mutations for even non-specially-registered URLs, like `blob:`

URLs. For example, before this CL, Blink allowed changing

`blob:https://example.com/{UUID-HERE}` to

`blob:https://spoof.com@example.com/abcd`, which is

same-origin, so the code permitted it, but it was a path

change, which is illegal per spec. What's more is that this is

considered a UI URL spoof, and if you did this the browser

would change the URL bar to `about:blank#blocked` but the

document's URL would still be updated to the spoofed URL in

Blink; this led to really weird test expectations [2]. This

CL fixes the behavior and those test expectations



After this CL and the fixes mentioned above, there are still two

outstanding non-standard conditions that this algorithm maintains:

1. Allowing non-HTTP(s) opaque documents to mutate their query and

fragment, for historical compatibility concerns that are documented

in the code.

2. Allowing "standard"-scheme URLs — which includes `filesystem:` and

ones registered specially by //content embedders, like

`chrome:`, `chrome-extension`, etc. — to change their path, query,

and fragment, which is a much looser policy than we apply to other

URLs.



Additionally, before this CL, because we didn't even allow `pushState()`

to be called on `about:blank` documents at all, we never had to

implement step 4 of

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C/#url-and-history-update-steps, which

ensures that `pushState()` on `about:blank` documents are done with the

"replace" navigation mode. Now that this CL enables this to be hit, we

must implement that step to be spec compliant. Without it, tests like

`iframe-src-204-pushState-replaceState.html` would fail.



[1]: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#can-have-its-url-rewritten

[2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/blob_storage/blob_url_browsertest.cc;l=173-177;drc=cb17f93f3a17a6831cf90d616e23840f2ca726a5



Bug: 1239052,1465972

Change-Id: Id23d894d33c955894757d970d39a68076f2a8d5d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4701743

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

entry.title: [Android][I18n] Reset settings-invisible fields in address editors.
entry.content:
Address editor field set is dynamic and depends on the selected

country. Right now if the field gets invisible due to the selected

country, it's still stored in the underlying model. Users expect

such fields to get cleared.



The code defines the set of dynamic fields and resets only such kind

of fields. This is done to prevent resetting fields which are merely

not available in the specific editor.



Note: this functionality was present before, but was dropped during

the transition between AddressField and ServerFieldType enumerations.



Bug: 1441904

Change-Id: I61cdd7e1252318640a3b4182b5f3c5e8f0652c6a

entry.title: Fix custom-properties/registered-inheritance.html
entry.content:
There is always a danger when running a test on a short-duration

running animation, that by the time we receive the start time from

the compositor, the animation is already finished. The play state

is not critical to what is being tested here. Starting the animation

in a paused state guarantees that the test runs before the animation

is finished.
